description: Manage customer support tickets, agents and monitoring.

blocks.name: getTickets
blocks.description: Use filters to view only specific tickets (those which match the criteria that you choose). By default only tickets that have not been deleted or marked as spam will be returned, unless you use the 'deleted' filter.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: filter
args.info: The various filters available are new_and_my_open, watching, spam, deleted

args.name: userId
args.info: Find Tickets by userId

args.name: email
args.info: Find Tickets by e-mail

args.name: companyId
args.info: Find Tickets be Company ID

args.name: updatedSince
args.info: By default only tickets that have been created within the past 30 days will be returned. For older tickets, use this field. Example: 2017-03-27 (ISO 8601)

args.name: orderBy
args.info: Order Tickets by created_at, due_by, updated_at, status. Default: created_at

args.name: orderType
args.info: asc/desc. Default: desc

blocks.name: getSingleTicket
blocks.description: Find Ticket by ID. By default, certain fields such as conversations, company name and requester email will not be included in the response. They can be retrieved via the embedding functionality for extra API request points.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: ticketId
args.info: Ticket ID

args.name: includeConversations
args.info: Will return ten conversations sorted by 'created_at' in ascending order. Including conversations will consume two API calls. In order to access more than ten conversations belonging to a ticket, use the ???. Default: false

args.name: includeRequester
args.info: Will return the requester's email, id, mobile, name, and phone. Default: false

args.name: includeCompany
args.info: Will return the company's id and name. Default: false

args.name: includeStats
args.info: Will return the ticket’s closed_at, resolved_at and first_responded_at time. Default: false

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.info: Api Key

args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the requester

args.name: requesterId
args.info: User ID of the requester. For existing contacts, the requester_id can be passed instead of the requester's email.

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

args.name: facebookId
args.info: Facebook ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this facebook_id, then a new contact will be created.

args.name: phone
args.info: Phone number of the requester. If no contact exists with this phone number in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact. If the phone number is set and the email address is not, then the name attribute is mandatory.

args.name: twitterId
args.info: Twitter handle of the requester. If no contact exists with this handle in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

args.name: subject
args.info: Subject of the ticket. The default Value is null.

args.name: type
args.info: Helps categorize the ticket according to the different kinds of issues your support team deals with. The default Value is null.

args.name: status
args.info: Status of the ticket. The default Value is 2.

args.name: priority
args.info: Priority of the ticket. The default value is 1.

args.name: description
args.info: HTML content of the ticket.

args.name: responderId
args.info: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned

args.name: attachments
args.info: Array of file links (url). The total size of these attachments cannot exceed 15MB.

args.name: ccEmails
args.info: Array of email address added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email

args.name: customFields
args.info: Key value pairs containing the names and values of custom fields. Read more here

args.name: dueBy
args.info: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved

args.name: emailConfigId
args.info: ID of email config which is used for this ticket. (i.e.,  support@yourcompany.com/sales@yourcompany.com) If product_id is given and email_config_id is not given, product's primary email_config_id will be set

args.name: frDueBy
args.info: Timestamp that denotes when the first response is due

args.name: groupId
args.info: ID of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. The default value is the ID of the group that is associated with the given email_config_id

args.name: productId
args.info: ID of the product to which the ticket is associated. It will be ignored if the email_config_id attribute is set in the request.

args.name: source
args.info: The channel through which the ticket was created. The default value is 2.

args.name: tags
args.info: Array of tags that have been associated with the ticket

args.name: companyId
args.info: Company ID of the requester. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above)

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.info: category ID

args.name: forumType
args.info: Denotes the type of forum. 1 - How To's, 2- Ideas, 3 -Problems, 4 - Announcements

args.name: forumVisibility
args.info: Denotes the visibility level of the forum. 1 - Everyone, 2 - Logged in users only, 3 - Agents only, 4 - Users in specific companies only

args.name: description
args.info: Description of the forum category

args.name: companyIdList
args.info: Comma-separated list of CompanyID. If forumVisibility property is set to 4, the forum is only visible to users belonging to certain companies. Example: 1,2,3

args.info: Agent ID

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: agentId
args.info: Agent ID

args.name: occasional
args.info: Set to true if this is an occasional agent (true => occasional, false => full-time)

args.name: signature
args.info: Signature of the agent in HTML format

args.name: ticketScope
args.info: Ticket permission of the agent (1 -> Global Access, 2 -> Group Access, 3 -> Restricted Access). Current logged in agent can't update his/her ticket_scope

args.name: group_ids
args.info: Group IDs associated with the agent. Example: 1,2

args.name: roleIds
args.info: Role IDs associated with the agent. Atleast one role should be assoicated with the agent. Current logged in agent can't update his/her role_ids

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the Agent

args.name: email
args.info: Email address of the Agent.

args.name: phone
args.info: Telephone number of the Agent.

args.name: mobile
args.info: Mobile number of the Agent

args.name: jobTitle
args.info: Job title of the Agent

args.name: language
args.info: Language of the Agent. Default language is 'en'

args.name: timeZone
args.info: Time zone of the Agent. Default value is time zone of the domain

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: ticketId
args.info: Ticket ID

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: ticketId
args.info: Ticket ID

args.name: body
args.info: Content of the note in HTML

args.name: attachments
args.info: Attachments associated with the note. The total size of all of a ticket's attachments cannot exceed 15MB.

args.name: incoming
args.info: Set to true if a particular note should appear as being created from outside (i.e., not through web portal). The default value is false

args.name: notifyEmails
args.info: Email addresses of agents/users who need to be notified about this note

args.name: private
args.info: Set to true if the note is private. The default value is true.

args.name: userId
args.info: ID of the agent/user who is adding the note

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Api Key

args.name: domain
args.info: Domain in freshdesk.com service. Example: your-company.freshdesk.com

args.name: name
args.info: Name of the contact

args.name: email
args.info: Primary email address of the contact. If you want to associate additional email(s) with this contact, use the other_emails attribute.

args.name: phone
args.info: Telephone number of the contact

args.name: mobile
args.info: Mobile number of the contact

args.name: twitterId
args.info: Twitter handle of the contact

args.name: otherEmails
args.info: Additional emails associated with the contact

args.name: companyId
args.info: ID of the primary company to which this contact belongs

args.name: viewAllTickets
args.info: Set to true if the contact can see all the tickets that are associated with the company to which he belong

args.name: otherCompanies
args.info: Additional companies associated with the contact. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above)

args.name: address
args.info: Address of the contact.

args.name: avatar
args.info: Avatar image of the contact The maximum file size is 5MB and the supported file types are .jpg, .jpeg, .jpe, and .png

args.name: customFields
args.info: Key value pairs containing the name and value of the custom field. Only dates in the format YYYY-MM-DD are accepted as input for custom date fields. Read more here

args.name: description
args.info: A small description of the contact

args.name: jobTitle
args.info: Job title of the contact

args.name: language
args.info: Language of the contact. Default language is en. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Language feature is enabled (Garden plan and above)

args.name: tags
args.info: Comma-separated tags associated with this contact

args.name: timeZone
args.info: Time zone of the contact. Default value is the time zone of the domain. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Time Zone feature is enabled (Garden plan and above)
